subject: junit.tests.runner.TestCaseClassLoaderTest - ClassNotFoundException
msgSnippet: OS: Windows NT 4.0 SP6a Java: 1.4.2_04-b05 From the dos prompt I run the following via a .bat set classpath=H: languages java JUnit junit3.8.1
messageBody:
OS: Windows NT 4.0 SP6a
Java: 1.4.2_04-b05

From the dos prompt I run the following via a .bat

set classpath=H:\languages\java\JUnit\junit3.8.1
\junit.jar;H:\languages\java\JUnit\junit3.8.1
\junit.jar;H:\languages\java\JUnit\junit3.8.1
\junit\tests\runner;H:\languages\java\JUnit\junit3.8.1\junit\samples;

c:\j2sdk1.4.2_04\bin\java junit.textui.TestRunner
junit.samples.AllTests

I then get the following error

1) testClassLoading(junit.tests.runner.TestCaseClassLoaderTest)
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: junit.tests.runner.ClassLoaderTest
at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.lookupClassData
(TestCaseClassLoader.java:124)
at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.loadClass
(TestCaseClassLoader.java:101)
at junit.tests.runner.TestCaseClassLoaderTest.testClassLoading
(TestCaseClassLoaderTest.java:16)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)

The ClassLoaderTest.class and ClassLoaderTest.java are there and in
the same directory as TestCaseClassLoaderTest.java. This is weird.

It gets weirder. When I run c:\j2sdk1.4.2_04\bin\java
junit.swingui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests, now it can't find
AllTests but it was found in the previous command.
